channel.title: Garrosh on From Draenor With Love
channel.description: Recent content in Garrosh on From Draenor With Love

item.title: The Siege of Orgrimmar
item.description: Patch 5.4 is almost here! I‚Äôm totally pumped, but I‚Äôm also dreading it! I want to see the cool new raid content and bosses, but I don‚Äôt WANT to kill Nazgrim! I don‚Äôt WANT to kill the Paragons! And I don‚Äôt want to kill Garrosh! (He‚Äôs a major From Draenor With Love character, after all!) Speaking of the comic, this strip marks an important milestone for us. Starting next week, everything is changing!

item.title: Whateverstone is More Like It
item.description: I‚Äôm not sure I know of a character in any book, movie or game who has had their personality and history thrown to the wayside and trampled into the dust as much as Garrosh has this expansion. I mean, in Cataclysm he certainly wasn‚Äôt perfect, but he had distinct good points to accompany his flaws, was a good character foil for his mirror image, Varian, and was showing definite signs of growth from his hotheaded, annoying days of being a mad dog yipping at Thrall during Wrath.

item.title: The Proudmoore ‚ÄúProblem‚Äù
item.description: A lot of people think Jaina has this terrible reputation regarding the men in her life, that she has ‚Äúterrible taste in men‚Äù, or that she breaks guys‚Äô hearts and/or makes them go crazy. This is utter nonsense. The problem isn‚Äôt with Jaina, the problem is that the men in her life are just plain jerks. Have you actually LISTENED to the crap these guys say? It‚Äôs pretty sad when Garrosh of all people has treated her with more dignity and respect than her so-called close friends.

item.title: iWrynny
item.description: Somewhere out there in Pandaria, there‚Äôs an armorsmith with one twisted sense of humor. Poor clueless little Anduin. Hands up if you saw him step onto that platform covered in Sha magic and walk right up to Garrosh, and thought to yourself ‚Äúwelp, I have a bad feeling about how this is going to turn out.‚Äù AND SURE ENOUGH. Should have listened to Dezco, kid. Even if he does wear babies as armor.

item.title: You Know He Would, Part Two
item.description: The inevitable result of last week‚Äôs devious scheme. (Really, this moment was so amazing, how could we NOT give it the full-comic spotlight it deserves??) You know, in-game Garrosh is unpleasant and thoroughly unlikeable, and Blizzard is going to great lengths to portray him as an absolute monster. But I‚Äôm a big fan of THIS Garrosh, the one who isn‚Äôt concerned about world domination or wiping cities off the map, but just sticking it to Varian and being a general pain in the ass.

item.title: You Know He Would, Too
item.description: Still the highlight of the expansion so far, in my opinion. Let‚Äôs be honest. How many of us re-did this quest, over and over again, just to repeatedly wallop Varian in his giant chin? Who could possibly resist?? Headcanon: Garrosh sitting down in his throne room with a paper and clipboard. On the left-hand side of the page: Strong new allies. Much-needed boost to the Horde‚Äôs ranks. New culture and knowledge that will strengthen the Horde.

item.title: Surprisingly Often, Actually
item.description: From Draenor With Love launched November 1, 2011, which means it‚Äôs been an entire year! üòÄ I am pretty pleased that we put out a comic each and every week, even when life kicked us around a bit, or when one of us was traveling. Thanks to everyone who‚Äôs read our stuff over the past year! We appreciate your visits, your comments, your retweets, all of it! Also, a special thanks to Dee, Ayms/Mits, and Walks, who gave us awesome guest strips!

item.title: Priorities
item.description: This is actually a true story. On launch night, we were a few hours in and realized that our Legendary-toting Boomkin was sitting in the Barrens somewhere fishing up Tasty Crapfish and Garbage Trout trying to get realm-first fishing, two of us were hanging out in starter zones furiously battling and taming new pets, and our infamous guild AH tycoon was expanding his financial empire with lucrative Pandaria ore/herb sales.

item.title: The Art of War, Part Two
item.description: HEY MURADIN PUT A BIRD ON IT Like we said last week‚Ä¶Warrior glyphs in Mists = THE COOLEST. Some news about the next few weeks! This weekend, we‚Äôll be attending a Comic Expo in Calgary! Excitement! Our strip next week will be something based off the Expo, we hope. Then, the week after that we plan on presenting the special guest strip for Great Blog Noblegarden Egg Hunt! So keep your eyes peeled!

item.title: The Art of War, Part One
item.description: A Glyph that causes a lightning strike? ‚Ä¶I have a sudden urge to play a warrior in Mists. Seriously though, it‚Äôs terrific that Blizzard is giving us all these new fun cosmetic glyphs. They‚Äôre little touches, but damn are they cool. My personal favorite so far? That would be Glyph of the Geist. BECAUSE GEISTS ARE AWESOME. (In other news, I think Vid is going to revolt if I make her draw Garrosh again.

item.title: Not Who We Expected
item.description: As everyone knows by now, Garrosh Hellscream will be the boss of Mists of Pandaria‚Äôs final content patch, and we take him down in an exciting-sounding ‚ÄúSiege of Orgrimmar.‚Äù Now, there‚Äôs a lot of time between now and then, but I have to say‚Ä¶given what we‚Äôve seen of Sylvanas in Cataclysm ‚Äì being quite dastardly towards the Worgen during their starting zone, raising unwilling humans into new Forsaken and conscripting them into her forces, and her cold and callous treatment towards Koltira ‚Äì I really expected her to be the Horde leader we‚Äôd end up killing as a raid boss.

item.title: Your Racial Leader is Thinking About You
item.description: It occurred to Vid and I yesterday that perhaps we should have saved the comic with the NAKED ORC for our Valentine‚Äôs Day update. Apparently we are unable to read calendars. We figured we needed to do SOMETHING love-themed for this week ‚Äì after all, the comic IS From Draenor With LOVE! Well, who better to feature on our special Valentine‚Äôs Day card than another local from Draenor, the Warchief himself!
